newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to mull CVRD sell-off plan Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to mull CVRD sell-off plan Thursday.

text.p: A proposed model for the privatization of Brazilian mining conglomerate Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (CVRD) will be studied for the first time by the National Privatization Council at a meeting on Thursday.

Planning Minister Antonio Kandir told reporters the proposals, drawn up by a group of consultants led by Merrill Lynch, would be put to Thursday's meeting which begins at 1500 local time/1400 EDT/1800 GMT, but declined to give further details.

The consultants are believed to have recommended that the government auction 45 percent of CVRD's voting shares in a block sale, with the remaining 31 percent it owns being sold via international offerings and to employees.
The sale of CVRD is expected to begin in February 1997 and raise about $6.0 billion, making it the biggest Latin American privatization to date.
